intro: Hydrangea durifoiia, commonly known as the roughleaf hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that can range in color from blue to pink depending on soil pH. The plant produces opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of sterile flowers. Hydrangea durifoiia thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens.
